nodes.text: Commander, we're receiving a signal - it's....
It's Obadiah Looby.

branches.responseText: Well, that's nice of him. Put him on.
Let's see if we can talk some sense into him.
Fine, let's see what he has to say.

nodes.text: So, you're the one running Markham's Marauders these days.
You seem familiar. Do I know you from somewhere?

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Background: Frontier Freelancer]</color> I freelanced for a while. Probably passed by each other on the way to somewhere else.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Background: Inner Sphere Mercenary]</color> Probably saw my face in warrior's hall somewhere, back when I was trying to get hired.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Background: Solaris Gladiator]</color> I was an amateur fighter on Solaris for a while. Maybe you caught one of my matches?
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Background: Merchant Guard]</color> I served in the Merchant Guard for a while, could've bumped into each other there.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Background: Frontier Pirate]</color> We might've crossed paths before... from a distance.
I don't think so, but stranger things have happened before.

nodes.text: That could be it.
Now that I think about... yeah, that might've been it.

That's it! I remember now.

We were in our DropShip one time and all we had was nothing but Solaris fights to watch.

You were one of the better pilots.
Could be. Seen a lot of Merchant Guard in my life.

What a suspiciously vague answer.

Says a lot, though.
Must be me and my old memory playing tricks on me.
Anyway, I called you up for a simple reason - I want y'all to bail on this before it's too late.

None of you know what a clusterfuck you've stepped into. And I've got a soft spot for the folks who stood with me and mine on Fjaldr.

I know you understand, Darius.
I... appreciate the concern, but you know we can't just cut and run.
Yeah, yeah.... MRB this, MRB that...
Just saying, I'm on Davion's paycheck for this one, and I know Liao and Marik's got folks in play on this job too. Dunno who you're working for, but sooner or later, we're gonna be trading shots.
Mr. Looby, my name is Alexander Mad-
Don't even try to buy out my contract. You ain't got the C-Bills to do it.

Anyway, think about what I said.

Hope you make the right decision. Otherwise...
[Looby cuts the signal.]
About Looby...

branches.responseText: Let's take some time to think about that. I don't think we're going to face him right away.

nodes.text: Ahem... I have some missions you can choose.
First is an important one - we've got a supply convoy moving food and munitions for the Royal Guards that needs an escort.
Second one is taking out what appears to be the pirates' backup facility.
No idea what the odds of running into Looby are, but in my opinion, if you think it'll be a problem, you might want to deal with the base instead.

branches.responseText: I appreciate the thought, Lord Madeira. Darius?
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Flashpoint Decision: C]</color> I hate putting the Restoration in a hard spot, but I think we're all better off taking the partial completion reward.

nodes.text: Yes, Commander?

branches.responseText: Find out what the crew thinks about the Looby situation. By the time we get back from this next mission, I want to know how they feel.

nodes.text:
I understand, Commander. After everything the Restoration's been through, I can't blame anyone who doesn't want to wind up shooting at old friends.

You'll get the agreed upon payment, and we won't hold this against you.
What's your plan, Commander?
Alright... let's just hope we don't run into Looby on this one.
Got it, Commander. Let's get ready, people!
